revised_title: A Mechanical Approach to Understanding Medicinal Effects on the Human Body
tldr: The author provides a detailed mechanical explanation of how medicines work on the human body, focusing on the digestive system and the effects of vomitives, purgatives, diuretics, sudorifics, cordials, and opiates. The text covers the anatomy of the stomach, bowels, and other organs, as well as the various ways medicines interact with the animal spirits and humors in the body. The author argues against the "vulgar doctrine" of specific virtues in medicines and offers a more mechanistic approach to understanding their effects.
